metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday and Second Sunday after Pentecost

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems a humanity that is in a state of 'primordial catastrophe' and self-destruction.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: The God who pursues us even beyond the grave
God’s love spends itself to the very last drop
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities
to redeem his entire creation from its impulse toward self-destruction

zender.identificatie: The Triune Nature of God (Inner core of Love)
tekstueel_bewijs: whose nature it is to give that love to his creatures without restraint

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation/Blood) and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ
God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a Cosmic Power / Self-Destruction / Resistance
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as a 'catastrophe' and 'estrangement' that requires an 'all-powerful Father' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and 'fear of the Lord' as an entrance into the larger life.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Psalmist
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (confession) is explicitly stated as a result of being 'about to be saved' by the primary actor (God).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The love of God bears all things

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
you would do anything... to reverse the situation
knowledge that he and everyone else is a miserable offender
total inability to present ourselves righteous
God who can redeem humanity from so grave a predicament

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) met by God's 'pouvoir' (sovereign power to save).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Depths' (S2) through the realization of 'No Health' (~S2) to the 'Plenteous Redemption' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's nature as 'self-giving love' which bridges the gap between the sinner and the Holy God.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'primordial catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active subject of salvation and defines the human condition as one of total inability, making grace the only possible engine of the narrative.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine for a moment that you are the parent...

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The God who pursues us even beyond the grave with his resurrection power.
Sin is not breaking rules but estrangement... a vast primordial catastrophe.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human parents/mentors are used as 'hints' or 'glimmers' of God, but the sermon explicitly states they are only small measures and often fail.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats them as receivers of grace rather than models of performance.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'renewed confidence' through the removal of the burden of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God is the sole author of the rescue.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'depths' of the law/sin to the 'heights' of Trinitarian grace is perfectly integrated.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' and the one who 'pours forth' the love of God into the believer.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's character (Sender) and God's action (Subject). The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver of a gift they cannot earn.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' by grounding human love in the prior and superior reality of the Trinity.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'parent' metaphor's emotional appeal, Greimas shows that the metaphor actually functions to define the 'Sender's' motivation.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek of 2 Cor 13; semiotics shows how the Trinitarian formula functions as a 'Performance' of God's character.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'miserable offender' is not a psychological state but a necessary actantial position (Receiver) to allow God to be the Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon adheres strictly to Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace.
